title: Prince Christian of Denmark declines royal pension he was expected to receive on 18th birthday
description: Denmark's Prince Christian will turn down the royal pension he's entitled to when he turns 18 later this year so he can focus on his studies rather than royal duties.

title: Chicago drops murder charges against mother accused of telling son to shoot man; she then sues city

description: Massachusetts Gov. Maura Healey is in Ireland to help commemorate the 30th anniversary of the decriminalization of homosexuality in the country.

title: 4 dead, 3 remain missing following Chinese landslides
description: Authorities in China evacuated over 900 people due to landslides on June 27, 2023. Four people were killed, and three remain missing due to the landslides.

title: Germany saw record number of extremely violent antisemitic crimes in 2022, according to report
description: A report found that while Germany had fewer antisemitic incidents in 2022 compared to the previous year, extremely violent crimes such as shootings reached a record number.

title: Mets lose to Brewers, fall to season-high 8 games under .500
description: The Milwaukee Brewers beat the New York Mets on Monday night 2-1 behind Joey Wiemer's two-run home run in the sixth inning to drop the Mets to a season-high 8 games under .500.

title: Fox News Power Rankings: Previewing 2024 battleground states, key congressional races
description: The 2024 presidential election reveals new campaign themes and electoral vulnerabilities. Here are Fox News' new projections for the critical battleground states.

title: Biden repeatedly denied discussing business deals with Hunter, but evidence suggests otherwise
description: President Biden and the White House have long maintained the president has not discussed Hunter's business dealings, but evidence has suggested otherwise.

title: First on Fox: DeSantis, Haley to speak in Iowa at rising GOP star Hinson's annual BBQ Bash
description: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis and former ambassador & South Carolina Gov. Nikki Haley are the first of the 2024 Republican presidential candidates to RSV for Rep. Ashely Hinson's annual BBQ

title: Oilers' Connor McDavid picks up third Hart Trophy, nearly unanimously
description: Edmonton Oilers star Connor McDavid was awarded the Hart Trophy for the third time in his career. The Hart Trophy is given to the NHL's MVP.

title: Maine Democratic Gov. Janet Mills signs law partially decriminalizing prostitution
description: Janet Mills has signed a law that partially decriminalizes prostitution in Maine. The law is meant to help those who were pushed into sex trafficking due to desperate circumstances.

title: House Republicans divided over push to 'expunge' Trump impeachment
description: Some House Republicans are seeking to expunge former President Trump second House impeachment even as he faces fresh federal charges in Florida.

title: 4 people who were found dead in charred Arkansas home were killed from gunshot wounds, according to police
description: Little Rock police announced that the four bodies that were found in a burned Arkansas home were killed by gunshot wounds. The investigation into the people's death is ongoing.

title: Some states consider taxing by the mile rather than gallon as electric vehicles become more popular
description: Some states across the country are considering taxing vehicles based on the distance they travel rather than how much fuel they use, in part due to inflation and fuel efficiency.

title: Severe weather leaves more than 175K without power in southern, eastern regions
description: Severe weather, including tornadoes and thunderstorms, left more than 175,000 customers without power on Tuesday morning, and impacted flights at major travel hubs.

title: Shaq gets candid about past relationships: 'I had two perfect women and I messed it up'
description: Basketball Hall of Famer Shaquille O'Neal talked about his past relationships and the two women he left slip away because he "messed it up."

title: Lukashenko warns of Belarusian ‘combat readiness’: 'If Russia collapses, all of us will die'
description: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko told state media Tuesday that his military was brought to "combat readiness" in reaction to the Wagner Group revolt.

title: What China is doing in Cuba is a big threat to all of us
description: China has reactivated an old Soviet Union base in Cuba, and currently is in talks to stand up a military training facility within 100 miles of Florida.

title: Bill Maher rails against NYT, media for hostile RFK Jr. coverage: 'I'm pissed off'
description: On his "Club Random" podcast, Bill Maher took aim at the legacy media's "arrogance" for its attacks against Biden challenger Robert F. Kennedy Jr.

title: Hear a good Sunday sermon? AI ready to make preacher's words count all week long
description: Pulpit AI is an upcoming artificial intelligence platform that can aide Christian pastors by reconfiguring sermons to keep congregants engaged throughout the week.

title: Fire in the United Arab Emirates engulfs high-rise residential building
description: A large fire tore through a high-rise residential building before fire fighters brought the blaze under control in the United Arab Emirates. There were also no reports of injuries.

title: Severe weather across Northeast, mid-Atlantic brings thunderstorm hazards
description: As severe weather over the Northeast and mid-Atlantic regions bring heavy rain and flooding threats, heat over Texas will expand and extend from the Southwest through the Southeast.

title: NYC adds Diwali to list of public school holidays
description: Diwali has been added to New York City's list of public school holidays. The holiday happens in October or November, depending on the lunar calendar.

title: Jet linked to Prigozhin arrives in Belarus, Wagner Group chief says purported mutiny was just a 'protest'
description: Wagner Group chief Yevgeny Prigozhin is reportedly in Belarus after a jet linked to the mercenary leader was observed landing near the country's capital of Minsk.

title: Teen in New Mexico allegedly shoots, kills 52-year-old man in movie theater over seat dispute
description: A 19-year-old allegedly shot and killed a 52-year-old man following an argument over seating at a movie theater in Albuquerque, New Mexico.

title: Mother of Buffalo shooting survivor faces off against former mayoral candidate in local New York primaries
description: Zeneta Everhart, the mother of a survivor of the Buffalo mass shooting, is facing off against a former Buffalo mayoral candidate in a race for a seat on the city's Common Council.

title: LSU star Dylan Crews takes page out of Angel Reese's book at College World Series
description: LSU baseball star Dylan Crews took a page out of Angel Reese's book on Monday night and pointed to his ring finger after he was called safe on a triple.

title: New York receives federal approval to charge Manhattan drivers in an attempt to reduce congestion
description: A first-in-the-nation plan to charge drivers in popular New York City areas has received federal approval. The plan is meant to improve air quality and reduce traffic.

title: Rachel Bush, wife of Bills' Jordan Poyer, says charity golf event was nixed 'due to the arrogance of others'
description: Rachel Bush, the wife of Buffalo Bills star Jordan Poyer, explained why his celebrity golf event, which was supposed to be held at Trump National Doral, was canceled.

title: 'Sound of Freedom' exposes brutal fight to rescue victims of child trafficking
description: "Sound of Freedom," a film based on the founding of a child-trafficking rescue organization called Operation Underground Railroad, premieres across the country on July 4.

title: Jean-Pierre claims 'Americans feel better' about finances under Biden: 'What world is she living in?'
description: White House press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre defended President Biden’s economic policies on Monday despite his low approval ratings on the economy.

title: Derek Carr reveals last straw in Raiders relationship: 'Once they made my wife cry, that was pretty much over'
description: Derek Carr revealed Saturday his relationship with the Las Vegas was pretty much over even if there was a chance to meet in the middle.

title: FBI Director Christopher Wray to testify before House Judiciary Committee amid calls to resign
description: FBI Director Christopher Wray will make an appearance before the House Judiciary Committee, where Republican lawmakers get a chance to question his handling of the bureau.

title: Putin's rebellion curveball, Idaho suspect heads to court amid death penalty bombshell and more top headlines
description: Putin's rebellion curveball, Idaho suspect heads to court amid death penalty bombshell and more top headlines

title: Brittney Griner calls airport harassment incident 'rock bottom' for WNBA
description: Phoenix Mercury All-Star center Brittney Griner spoke for the first time about the harassment incident that occurred at Dallas/Fort Worth International Airport on June 10.

title: NCAA endangers student athletes with terrible message on drugs
description: An NCAA committee "signaled its support" to remove marijuana from the organization’s list of banned substances and instead focus testing only on "performance-enhancing drugs."

title: Britney Spears, Lindsay Lohan, Zachery Ty Bryan: Child stars who went from Hollywood to handcuffs
description: Zachery Ty Bryan, Lindsay Lohan and Britney Spears each publicly struggled after finding fame at a young age. After a successful start, each found themselves in trouble with the law.

title: Hunter Biden whistleblower testimony shows 'someone is lying' as DOJ under new scrutiny: Miranda Devine
description: First son Robert Hunter Biden's plea deal led to new scrutiny after whistleblowers claimed to Congress that the investigation may have been hindered by DOJ.

title: Penn State professor says school forced him to teach English language is 'White supremacy:' 'Religious cult'
description: A Penn State professor, Zack De Piero, is suing his former employer for allegedly fostering a racially hostile work environment which blasted White people as 'problematic.'

title: Prince William reveals Princess Diana's charity work left 'deep and lasting impression' on him
description: Prince William launched a project on Monday to help end homelessness in the U.K. Princess Diana took her son to a homeless shelter when he was 11 and met "extraordinary people."

title: Russia drops charges against Prigozhin, other participants of Wagner Group rebellion
description: Russian authorities announced Tuesday that mercenary chief Yevgeny Prigozhin and other participants in the armed rebellion over the weekend would not be charged.

title: Pete Buttigieg consulted China-tied group pushing gas stove bans, electric vehicle mandates
description: Biden Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg consulted late last year with a left-wing climate group that has been at the forefront of the push to electrify the economy.

title: Virginia school employee facing charges for forcible sodomy, abduction: police
description: An employee of Arlington Public Schools in Virginia was arrested and charged with abduction and sexual assault following an incident with a woman leaving a night club, police said.

title: Ex-CIA spy turned GOP presidential candidate Will Hurd calls Biden ‘worst border security president’ ever
description: Republican presidential candidate and former CIA spy Will Hurd, who is touring the U.S. border with Canada, calls Joe Biden the 'wo rst border security president in our history'

title: ‘The View’ host Sunny Hostin blasts ‘hypocrisy’ of evangelical community for supporting Trump after indictment
description: "The View" co-host Sunny Hostin ripped "the hypocrisy of the evangelical community" for continuing to support former President Trump after he was indicted on federal charges.

title: Tennessee Rep. Green introduces States Choose Life Act to stop Biden admin's 'retribution' on pro-life states
description: Rep. Mark Green, a Republican from Tennessee, will introduce legislation Tuesday that aims to protect pro-life states from the Biden administration.

title: Former Navy SEAL challenges vulnerable Dem senator in red state race vital for 2024 Senate majority
description: Republican Tim Sheehy, a former Navy SEAL and successful businessman, threw announced his campaign for the 2024 Montana Senate race "to retire Jon Tester" in 2024.

title: BlackRock, CEO Larry Fink are ‘poster children for ESG,’ critic says: ‘Phenomenon that must be opposed’
description: A leading BlackRock opponent feels the company and CEO Larry Fink are "poster children for ESG," which has made the high-powered executive a target of conservatives.

title: Bud Light controversy dismissed by country artist Tyler Farr amid Garth Brooks backlash: 'Kind of silly'
description: Country star Tyler Farr shared his thoughts on the Bud Light controversy, calling it "silly stuff." Farr is also releasing new music celebrating his "redneck" roots with a new EP.

title: Nothing to see here: Democrats ignore alleged Biden corruption
description: Congressional Democrats are ignoring the growing evidence surrounding President Biden and his family's alleged corruption by voting against transparency.

title: Elon Musk agrees to train with UFC legend Georges St-Pierre before potential cage match with Mark Zuckerberg
description: Elon Musk agreed to train with UFC legend Georges St-Pierre ahead of a potential bout with Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg. The two billionaires previously agreed to a cage match.

title: Putin blinks: Aborted mercenary coup appears to weaken Russian leader
description: I don’t know whether the leader of Russia’s mercenary forces seriously planned a coup attempt in Moscow but what I do know is that Putin blinked.

title: New Jersey police issue warning to driver dumping adult diapers, urine pads on roadway
description: A driver in New Jersey was seen dumping trash bags containing adult diapers and urine pads onto a roadway in multiple towns, according to police.

title: Wimbledon teams up with IBM to introduce generative AI video commentary and highlight clips
description: The All England Club is partnering with tech giant IBM to bring AI-generated audio commentary and captions to the Grand Slam tournament's online highlights videos.

title: AI companies risk US national security by working with China. Time to choose sides
description: America is at a critical period in our strategic competition with China, and technology – especially Artificial Intelligence (AI) – will play a central role.

title: Prigozhin ‘monopoly’ over Wagner Group forces in Africa peddling Putin interests unclear following mutiny
description: As the Kremlin grapples with how to handle Wagner Group chief Yevgeny Prigozhin, African nations wait to see how Putin's latest headache will affect their national security.

title: LSU beats Florida 18-4 to win College World Series despite losing previous game by 20 runs
description: The LSU Tigers won their seventh national title Monday evening after they defeated the Florida Gators 18-4 in Game 3 of the College World Series.

title: GREG GUTFELD: RFK Jr. is questioning Democratic orthodoxy
description: Fox News Host Greg Gutfeld looked at the differences between President Joe Biden and Democratic candidate RFK Jr. on "Gutfeld!"

title: On this day in history, June 27, 1985, iconic Route 66 reaches the 'end of the road'
description: On this day in history, June 27, 1985, the iconic Route 66 was decertified. The iconic highway ran through eight U.S. states and sections of it can still be driven today.

title: Try this easy 4th of July Bundt cake recipe that looks like a firework: 'So beautiful'
description: The red, white and blue drizzle atop this vibrant Bundt cake from blogger Katherine Salom looks like a sparking Fourth of July display, but in cake form. Try the festive recipe.

title: Corn dog bites, a viral 4th of July recipe: 'Easy to feed to a crowd'
description: Lifestyle blogger Macy Blackwell went viral on TikTok after she shared a festive Fourth of July corn dog recipe that turns the beloved food item into a bite-sized snack.
